Package trapomino

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Animal
    This abstract class will set the precedent for the methods pertaining to the Animals in the Game, all Animals will extend this class.
    Auxillary
    This class reads the sprites into the game and assigns them to their coordinating game objects.
    Bear
    This class creates and manages the Grid Position, direction, and movement of a Polar Bear.
    Bird
    This class creates and manages the Grid Position, direction, and movement of a Bird.
    Credits
    This class renders the Entities that are part of the Credits frame linked to the MainMenu.
    Entity
    This class creates, initializes, and manages the class variables used by the Entities in the Game.
    ErrorHandle
    This class creates a BufferedWriter file to log any encountered errors into as well as all of the individual file handlers and formatters.
    Grid
    This class will contain and manage all blocks in the grid, including Animals and Tetrominos.
    HighScores
    This class renders the Entities that are part of the HighScores frame linked to the InfiniteMenu.
    InfiniteGame
    This class manages the Endless game mode in Trapomino.
    InfiniteMenu
    This class renders the Entities that are part of the InfiniteGame menu frame linked to the MainMenu.
    Instructions
    This class renders the Entities that are part of the Instructions/Tutorial frame linked to the MainMenu.
    MainMenu
    This class renders and checks for interactions with the buttons on the main menu.
    Monkey
    This class creates and manages the Grid Position, direction, and movement of a Monkey.
    Options
    This class renders the Entities that are part of the Options frame linked to the MainMenu.
    Penguin
    This class creates and manages the Grid Position, direction, egg placement and movement of a Penguin.
    Position
    This class creates, sets, returns, and prints a Position of an Object on the Grid defined at a specific X and Y coordinate.
    Snake
    This class creates and manages the Grid Position, direction, and movement of a Snake.
    StoryGame
    This class manages the Story game mode in Trapomino.
    Tetromino
    This class will manage the class variables for the Tetromino blocks.
    TitleScreen
    This class manages the animations that show Trapomino's publisher and developers and then renders the TitleScreen's Entities and starts the game's music.
    Trapomino
    This is the main class of Trapomino, it runs the game, initializes the variables, creates the frame, manages the KeyListener and MouseListener, and alters the states, sounds, and settings of the game.
    UnionMap
    This class manages the UnionFind algorithm that will check to see if an Animal is trapped by blocks.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Grid.SHAPE
    This enum contains all of the shapes that can possibly be in the grid.
    Trapomino.STATE
    This enum contains all of the game states.
